photos.caption: Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

2nHuN654sLZSXyJvgqWAgw.text: Millie's is the go to ice cream place in the East End for a reason! They have a great variety of flavors that change the the seasons. Some are a very different from your typical flavors but all very good. The ice cream is rich and there waffle cones are made fresh. It's not as good as fancy ice cream places in NYC, but great for Pittsburgh. The only downside is that their scoops are labeled by a size name and not scoop number so I had to ask what each size actually meant... and it's a bit expensive. There are also extra charges for waffle cones and topping and they are a bit more than your average place. It can also get busy inside as it's a popular date spot!

ukNQdVLf1tbLfnfISRYHMg.text: The ice cream is so good! We had Vietnamese Coffee and Bourbon Maple. Both were very impressive flavors.   The Vietnamese Coffee flavor had a great coffee flavor. I was worried the coffee flavor wasn't going to be strong because I'm frequently let down at other establishments, but this really delivered!   The Bourbon Maple flavor did have a strong Bourbon flavor which was delicious.   Absolutely would recommend both flavors. Also the store was very clean.

bHa0mGjsM-XM_GyH-0OeUg.text: Always interesting flavors and equally as good ice cream. Their waffle cones are DELICIOUS and provide you with a welcoming smell as soon as you walk in the door. They provide a great mix of diverse flavors but also keep it simple by offering the traditional flavors like chocolate and vanilla. A little pricey but worth it to make a nice little trip out of it.

photos.caption: Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Single scoop in a cup
Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Did not get this flavor but thought it was very different

oQchuuC64EC8KWo-O7UAxQ.text: Friendly staff, delicious ice cream, and many choices! Loved it!! There was a long line after dinner and I can definitely understand why. Will be back once I'm back in Pittsburgh!

photos.caption: Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Yuuuum!

mb4jPv98niQktCk0SIUmMQ.text: We are gluten and dairy free. Nemecolin resort supplies their ice cream. We've NEVER had this....holy CRAP it's good!!  They had two vegan/gf flavors.  Bananas foster and dark chocolate.  Both INCREDIBLY creamy and neither tasted like coconut.... Not even a hint!  Which was nice because my 8 yr old hates coconut. The only complaint is that the chocolate makes your whole mouth brown....teeth and all.  Aside from that we are very happy and will be checking out the shady side location!

Eza1xWSpAfG06Nz0QX--JA.text: Had the hazelnut chocolate, which was absolutely delicious. They have a few staples, plus a few seasonal flavors, which are also very good. Extremely high quality using fresh ingredients!! Take a sample and try as many as you'd like.

photos.caption: Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

uRg_wNRUKiQUK765h2LRdg.text: Cutest little ice cream shop ever! Stopped for dinner next door at Noodlehead then came here after for dessert!! Will be back. As soon as you walk in, the whole place smells amazing!! The line was out the door but goes very quickly. We tried some samplers of different flavors and finally settled on a cup of cookie dough ice cream with crumpled waffle cones on top & a waffle cone with a scoop of brownie ice cream. Both were amazing!! You could tell the cones were very fresh, and had a great taste to them. The cookie dough had big chunks of cookie dough all through out it. Highly recommend! They do have benches outside to sit and some seating inside as well!

1A7UmTPwhnhQkoDE-CjmvQ.text: I went to Millie's for the first time the other day and got the cherry chocolate ice cream. It was ok. I had some of my friend's ice cream to try as well which was chocolate. The place is super cute but the ice cream is not out of this world which is what I expected upon seeing lots of people post about it.

HBAyjZLz8IHq1TpheOcZMA.text: Millie's has my favorite ice cream in Pittsburgh. They have excellent versions of staple flavors (chocolate, vanilla, etc.), but they also venture into more unique flavors (ex. ricotta almond) that are outstanding. Their waffle cones are also freshly-made with just the right amount of sweetness.  The only reason that I'm taking one star off is because it is rather expensive. You're looking at ~$6 for a single scoop in a waffle cone.

-4D-eyTR2cADKz_qO5UvTw.text: The ice cream is good! I got one scoop of hazelnut brownie and one of peanut butter. It was very tasty! However, there are a few things I wasn't a fan of. They don't have the best prices, which I kind of expected. The portions aren't the worst, but if I'm paying $5-$7 for a small I expect some big scoops comparable to Baskin Robbins. The parking is TERRIBLE. There's very limited street parking (that you pay for, of course) in front of the store - good luck finding a spot. Even the surrounding side streets were packed. For those who are lactose intolerant, they sell individual Lactaid pills by the cash register, which I thought was very considerate. I don't know about the price for that though. I don't know if I'd go out of my way to go back, but it was a pleasant experience if we ignore the years I spent traversing the neighborhoods to reach the parking-less store.

pafN1rMxh8tKo-hS9oCeQQ.text: This is apparently the spot to go to for ice cream in Shadyside.  It is legit always packed.  The smells coming from this place from the homemade waffle cones are heavenly.  I've only had the Vietnamese coffee ice cream and it is good enough that I'll prob never try another flavor.

4KUtRoaKHXBi5Wy9uj9uoA.text: I like to go to Millie's whenever I'm dining in the East Liberty/Shadyside area (especially Noodlehead). Noodlehead and Millie's are right next to each other so they are always a good combo for dinner and dessert. Their flavors change quite often. My personal favourite is Lavender and Chad's vanilla.  Their ice cream is known for its creamy texture. I gave them a 3 star because some of the flavours was too creamy and sweet for my taste. Also, it seems like the texture of their ice cream is not very consistent and changes a lot based on the day's batch of ice cream.

photos.caption: Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Yuzu blueberry in a mini cone

sBcoxzrxbQ1N8noSGL3Lig.text: Hands down my favorite ice cream place in all of Pittsburgh. All homemade ice cream with unique flavors like peach cheesecake, blueberry cobbler, Vietnamese coffee, lavender and more! All of the ingredients are labeled so if you have any food allergies that is incredibly helpful. When you walk in you will instantly be surrounded with the smell of freshly baked waffle cones and your excitement for the sweet treat will grow!!

5sNaf-ZifKTuu4ywkGIvHQ.text: I came here for the first time last weekend and had an ok experience. The ice cream wasn't anything special. I know its homemade, but it wasn't worth the price. I'll spend the money on fun new foods and desserts, but this homemade ice cream was not as good as other places I've had.  When we first walked in, it seemed like a really cute ice cream shop with a lot of flavors to try, but the flavors they had posted on the wall didn't seem consistent with what they were actually serving. Some of the flavors written on the wall weren't labeled in the cooler, so they weren't available, which is disappointing if you have your hopes up for a certain flavor. Also, the first person that asked to serve us didn't seem in a good mood. Yes, it was a Saturday night, but that's not a great first impression when a new customer walks in.  They had fun paintings on the wall, but not much seating available on a Saturday night. We found a spot at the bar-like area. The other employee was very nice and accommodating when I bothered him twice for an extra spoon, and then a lid to go.  The pictures shown are cookie dough and peanut butter on a cone!

photos.caption: Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. price menu
Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. cookie dough and peanut butter on a cone

1HYXxumO86cn5dOxYMP05g.text: I cannot pass up a cute ice cream boutique with unique flavors, I just cannot. Even after eating a giant fried chicken salad. Especially when the shop is as adorable as Millie's and features interesting high-end varieties (as well as some tried and True classics)!   Though they had a lot of tempting options on display when I visited, i didn't think twice once I saw the strawberry rosewater flavor. Those are two of my all-time favorite flavors of anything, so combined I knew I just couldn't resist. I got it in a cup and ordered the waffle cone pieces as a topping - such a genius idea for those who don't want to commit to an entire huge waffle cone (though the freshly made cones smelled amazing and were hard to say no to).   Ice cream is subjective, and personally I prefer a lighter, flavor-heavy kind vs. a super creamy rich kind, and this ice cream tended more toward Team Creamy. I wished I could taste a little bit more of the berry and rose flavors, but overall it was really well-made and of course tasty on a hot day. Browsing through all of the flavors listed at both of their locations (looks like they have different ones at their different stores) makes me wish I could come back on the daily and keep trying everything, but for now I'll have to just dream about another trip to Millie's until my next visit to PGH!

photos.caption: Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Scoop of roasted strawberry and rose with waffle cone pieces on top

U-WyHWiEwpQKS1n3VwbvIw.text: Great job to the professional ladies working hard on a VERY busy Wednesday night. During closing time, at 10 pm, the employees were met with a ridiculously rude and dramatic customer who could not take "No" for an answer. The girls handled the childish customer with tact and professionalism. Very impressed with their customer service skills and the delicious ice cream ! Will definitely be back.

BE7kaQ0zDXBxaq2wv7Rkig.text: Ice cream was great! The inside of the shop smelled delightful! There was a line to the door which is a always a good sign. I ordered a waffle cone with dulce de leche and Vietnamese coffee. Both were creamy and delicious. The waffle cone was the freshest I've ever tasted. The marshmallows at the bottom of the cone were a nice treat, since I love marshmallows. My husband got a chocolate milkshake and that shit was BOMB!    Service was decent but I'm a little concerned with the lady working behind the counter with long dreads that nearly dipped into the ice cream every time she reached down to scoop some out. Health code violation?   5 starts for the ice cream and service but minus 1 for the dread lock dipping , which was a little concerning :\  I would still come back, guaranteed.

photos.caption: Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Came back for more of that Vietnamese flavor with waffle cone and whip on top
Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Dulce de leche and Vietnamese coffee shoved into the most delicious , fresh waffle cone

UBoQ1sDgmvwaUEP8-VYypg.text: Went here for a treat on my husbands birthday.   We tried a few flavors and I decided to get a waffle cone with salted caramel and Vietnamese coffee. The cone was delicious and smelled heavenly. The salted caramel ice cream was very creamy and had a wonderful and balanced flavor. I really liked it paired with the coffee flavor which would have been too strong for me on its own.   I can't wait to go back to try more flavors.

Uf_-6FPqHKPUajZ6b2YjCA.text: Ok gang, this joint is so hip that it would be more accurate to refer to it as acetabulofemoral.  Boom! How's that for a physiology joke? Seriously, in a month or so when you hear that joke all over the place, you'll know where you heard it first.  Anyway, the ice cream is fantastic; probably the best coffee ice cream that I've ever had anywhere (Jeni's I'm looking in your direction.)  I have no idea how much it cost because I couldn't find pricing displayed anywhere (note: I was chasing toddlers so I might not have looked carefully enough) but I know it was great and it didn't cost that much.  Minus one star because it is in Pittsburgh; I promise to upgrade when the Browns win a Super Bowl and I can stop feeling inadequate.

1-PP-vJQRCPLjeWVsUJJCQ.text: I'm from out of town and was completely blown away by this ice cream! I told people afterwards how I'm always kind of *shrug* about getting ice cream - it's something people always want to do, but as a savory-lover myself, I never feel fulfilled afterwards. Wellllll I had quite the opposite experience at Millie's! As soon as you walk into the store, you smell the waffle cones's sugary scent and then your eyes notice a girl baking them behind the counter and then your mouth starts to water and you NEED a waffle cone that second. The pistachio honey special on the 4th of July was SO good, and I was relieved to see the girl scoop only one scoop in the cone because I feel like most places usually over do it on the ice cream and under-do the attention on the fact all you want is that waffle cone! Awesome place!! Will be back tonight :)

uvqFuNi_O_8xOImw948bpQ.text: Let me start off by saying I have a horrible horrible sweet tooth.  I am always on the look out for a great ice cream/ frozen yogurt place.  Decided to give Millie's a try and I was not disappointed.  First, if you look on their website you can see the ingredients of most of the ice creams you will encounter at the store, this trend likewise carries over to their store where the ingredients are listed under the ice cream title.  Second, love the atmosphere. As you ascend the stairs to this quaint little place, you almost go back in time.  The interior is rather retro and you get to really take a look around as you wait in the inevitable line.  I ended up getting the salted caramel, which was super creamy and smooth.  Unfortunately, this ice cream is REALLLLLLY salty.  I love salt but i couldn't finish this one.  Even so, the ice cream was excellent and next time ill be trying something on the chocolate spectrum.  You can bet I'll be back...in fact I may as well step up my cardio game in preparation ha ha.  Update! So since my previous review I have tried a few flavors: 1.  Honey Bourbon: This is my absolute flavor.  It is a light hint of honey with. mild flavor of bourbon, nothing too sweet or overwhelming.  Its just a nice refreshing soft cool flavor for a warm evening.   2.  Chocolate:  No joke, this is super chocolatey.  Unfortunately when I tried it...it was late evening and they literally had to scrape the bottom of the barrel... As such, my ice cream was kind of grainy and chalky... but I'm sure its better as long as they don't scrape the bottom for you. I'll keep you guys updated as I continue my stroll this enviable path of indulgence.

7um_r5q7CtFVtGWzn3VnNg.text: Well I love lavender ice cream. Rhubarb is a new hot thing that takes the place of lemon but still gives the sweet with the tart. Both of which are fantastic, and the current featured flavored. I'll be interested to see how often the flavors will turn.   Not to all, lines will increase as the night goes on. The smell of waffle cones is enough to make you smile.   Enjoy!!!!

bYGujKrtYbd6Ub2yFdHnUg.text: I've been following this place since before they even had an actual shop (or 2). Every flavor is thoughtfully made and delicious. I get something different every time and am never disappointed. I believe my boyfriend got their first ever birthday cake also and it was custom made and great so 6 stars if I could.

pD_TqEz_Xaqae_JEZMf9-A.text: I got a cone with the Peppermint and the Vietnamese Coffee and both flavors were exceptional! Both really large scoop portions. The homemade waffle cone was a little thin and bland but the ice cream was incredible. I also tasted the Olive Oil Ice Cream which I did not suspect to be any good and was actually insanely delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Peppermint &amp; Vietnamese Coffee Ice Cream in a homemade cone.

lcr8MT3ugwRPC9cjvTfCiQ.text: A lovely local ice creamery with a classic walk-up counter and pints available for sale. Certainly holds the "gourmet, local" product price tag, but well worthwhile (and I am always partial and happy to support small & local businesses). Normally, I would spring for a unique flavor, especially when paying a premium, but honestly, the classic Vanilla is my favorite!! The seasonal sweet potato pie was also delicious - with creamy marshmallows :)

8odk3sKX57k9yCmZGGUiiA.text: Absolutely love this place! They are very friendly, service is fast and the ice cream is magnificent!

sYcqOhuDVwWduW4tFQjfFA.text: Upon walking into Millie's, your decision to go has already been affirmed. The smells alone, which are free, tell you that you've made the best decision of your week by opting for Millie's ice cream.  I like ice cream. I eat it frequently. But Millie's is a whole new ice cream ballgame. The cones are freshly made with homemade batter. So fresh that the owner was making the batter between servings, and each cone is made to order. They are slightly buttery, warm...heaven on earth, if you will.  I had the salted caramel ice cream. It was perfection. It was not overly sweet and achieved the deep, burnt, salty caramel taste that I'm looking for in my life.  If you haven't gone to Millie's yet, you are surely missing out.

suGy9fOtsoGIhlxviTZx-Q.text: The staff was nice, but I think seven dollars for a vanilla milkshake is outrageous, especially given the size of the cup. It was a good milkshake, but not worth 7 bucks. Maybe some of the fancier flavors are worth it. I'll have to come back and see.   (3.5 stars)

Z6nOIV8VCp3xhOiEqyEUuw.text: Salted caramel gelato was really delicious--has a lot of salt flavor so watch out if you prefer regular caramel. We also tried the ricotta pistachio luxardo cherry, which seemed to have some orange zest in it as well (allergy sufferers, beware--it wasn't listed). I was disappointed that the ricotta flavor was quite mild, but the waffle cones were excellent and we'll definitely be back. Both concoctions could have benefited from a colder freezer--it was barely 50 degrees outside and we had soupy ice cream within a few minutes.   Millie's also suffers from the same problem as the previous tenant--the shape of the shop is long and deep, and so the logical place for the counter means that people trying to leave have to walk through the line. The space would benefit from some stanchions or something similar to keep the line in check.  Bonus points for having plentiful tap water and selling Lactaid pills ($0.50 each)--genius!

iYelwbTZpJTeXvFGxMwa4w.text: The best coffee ice cream and waffle cone i've ever had! The inside of the shop is so cute and they have water for dogs! My new fave ice cream shop

Y3vagQQeyl5o5iTbClyq8A.text: Overall, great ice cream and friendly staff. Loved the pistachio rose and the Thai iced tea (which was a little different from other places but still delicious)! I wasn't too impressed with the sorbet, but it may have just been the flavors that were on rotation today. Definitely check out this place if you're nearby - it's cute and delicious.

sd0TJ1PBwnhB0sKothcpPw.text: Their handmade ice cream and sorbets are delicious. I especially love their white peach sorbet. The fresh peach flavor is insane. The coconut lime is amazing as well. As for the ice cream flavors go, most of them are incredible, but some are a bit weird like Szechuan peach. The huge handmade waffle cones pack a ton of flavor. I love their ice cream and I will keep on returning for more.

whyCS0wmsf2UAdGiQu45WA.text: We stopped at Millie's on one of the first warm Saturday nights of the season and weren't sure what to think when we saw a line going out the door. Should we go somewhere else? How long would we wait if we stayed? We decided to get in line and it moved very quickly. The employees inside were super efficient in keeping things moving. Once we got near the door we were greeted by the sweet smell of Millie's freshly made waffle cones. It smelled so delicious. I opted for the Thai tea flavor in a junior size ($4) which is one scoop and a waffle cone (+$1). The Thai tea tastes just like the real thing from my favorite Thai restaurants. The perfect blend of tea flavor and milky sweetness. They also put a few mini marshmallows at the bottom of the cone that melt and make for a delicious last bite.

photos.caption: Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Thai tea

dVRLApFRsErExIIrRo2orw.text: First time tonight and blown away by the fresh homemade waffle cone! Will be back. Nice atmosphere with light and airy decor. Long line but it kept moving and it was worth it.

QC5NjgagLG23IlmYoYL8LQ.text: My first time at Millie's. I had a waffle cone with salted caramel and almond butter ice cream. It was pretty good. The flavors are great and rich. I will be returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The line is out the door. That&#39;s always a good sign.

uFABkrHjo0nGQgQjzG2N-A.text: Locally sourced and made ice cream always end up tasting better somehow, but it's the availability of all the rotating interesting flavors that keeps us coming back. For example, I know of nowhere else that has Vietnamese coffee ice cream, and it is definitely one of the best flavors they have, with a much stronger roast flavor than traditional coffee but also traced with condensed milk throughout. You can be more adventurous and try flavors like fig or spiced prune, which may not sound appetizing as ice cream but they really make it tasty and unique. They usually have some sorbets as well, whose textures are creamier than sorbets elsewhere and are pretty close to ice cream. A delicious tropical one is the coconut lime, which is light but zesty.

IIkiPliHd_M2gp6z9CEtiw.text: We are hard to impress, and we are small batch, homemade ice cream snobs. I got rhubarb crisp and my husband tried the Vietnamese coffee but settled on white chocolate rhubarb. Wish fig hadn't been out... wanted that too! So good... was the perfect ending to the spicy noodles we had next door!

ZR_BJ1gvZ3qjjz2XbUAGgw.text: Excellent ice cream! It tastes fresh and made with real ingredients. Unique flavors as well. I had the Vietnamese coffee which was great! The wait was a bit long, but I guess that's expected when the place is that great.

svUZefjj7amd5vU2qtSiKA.text: It's so good and worth the wait every time. I always get the waffle cone, and I'm currently loving the blueberry pancake. Everyone is so friendly even if you ask to try all sorts of flavors

7wlE82WNz63Oj7U_TzvpLQ.text: I'm not giving Millie's 5 stars, as a Columbus, Ohio native, I am very loyal to Jeni's ice cream, a very similar alternative. I tried the Vietnamese Coffee at Millie's in a waffle cone, obviously (since I'm a sucker for waffles) and it was OK! The price was right for a specialty flavored ice cream shop and the portions were very generous, but the flavor didn't wow me like I was hoping. The staff was friendly and I would definitely go back, maybe try a different flavor next time!   Sorry Pittsburgh, your Jeni's alternative isn't satisfying this Columbus girl's craving.

hGC2q4MXW98IIobW5WkJew.text: I'd suggest making a trip here, I live in the city of Pittsburgh and we still go every couple weeks!   If you'd ask me what I like, I'd have to say lavender.. So give that a try! lol

6f0_QXgawnm8HOgekh_jBg.text: In town just for the day to visit some museums, and decided on a snack before hitting the road. This area of Shadyside is tricky for parking - we ended up over the bridge and in a parking garage for PetsMart. But despite the hassle - the ice cream was amazing! Butter Pecan where the chunks of nuts are distinguishable and tasty, Lemon that is reminiscent of lemon meringue pie, and creamy vanilla - so much to love! Would definitely be back if in town again!

obtBbkABIyUCtV0xV0jLWA.text: I got their Vietnamese coffee and chocolate ice cream. Fantastic, would definitely stop by again

gcP31mvULnaX-t6Oh-JFRw.text: Best ice cream ever. There was a long line but it went super fast. I got one scoop of dulce de leche in a waffle cone. The scoop looked so small but ended up being so much! The best. Have to get the homemade waffle cone.

vB5NUilwlZWSugPwC_QBDQ.text: No doubt in my mind the best ice cream in Pittsburgh. Everything is good and they always have delicious, interesting flavors. Also, Chad's vanilla (their vanilla flavor) is the only vanilla I will buy at any ice cream shop.

BaBm0pHithT9A8A1_cShhQ.text: Best ice cream in Pittsburgh. Small batch homemade flavors that are ever changing and always interesting. Expect a line but it's worth it.

YMvyjge0BzSnNI7jkmz4VA.text: The flavors they offer are so interesting, and I was so pleased to see that they offer lavender ice cream, which was absolutely delicious. Beware, though -- the ice cream is truly rich and creamy, so it can feel very heavy after having eaten only a single scoop. But it's a lovely spot to treat yourself. The interior and exterior as well are adorable. A must-go for all ice cream lovers

photos.caption: Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

1IzkBD76bacgpD2WfP56_g.text: We went to Millie's after dinner for a sweet treat. The line was out the door. That's a good sign. The wait wasn't long before we were inside and smelling waffle cones baking. You can taste any of the flavors. They are all made and served fresh. After reading the menu I knew what I wanted-no tasting needed. I wasn't sure I wanted a waffle cone so imagine how thrilled I was to find out one of the toppings is waffle cone pieces. It was perfect. I had a scoop of The Very Best and a scoop of Hazelnut. The chocolate was very good. It tasted like the fudge pops we are as a kid. I wasn't thrilled with the Hazelnut until I realized there were actual hazelnuts in the ice cream. The crunch from the nuts and waffle cone pieces were s great added touch.  I love the whole pink theme. It's also nice that they have seating out front, inside, and in the back outside. I can't wait to bring friends to try it.

photos.caption: Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. 1st Bowl -Best Chocolate Ever &amp;!Hazelnut 2nd Bowl-Salted Caramel &amp; Hazelnut w/cone pieces.
Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Back patio

PlNDzC_dDounlnyJ0wScWA.text: I think I have been here three times now. This is one of those few establishments in Pittsburgh that I genuinely crave, that's because it is so good. Ironically, I am allergic to ice cream. I have gone multiple years at a time without any ice cream because it makes me so sick; however, I keep want to coming back here over and over again. There is only one other kind of ice cream I crave this much and that is homemade ice cream from my friend who is a pastry chef. Most recently, I had white chocolate plum in a waffle cone. The ice cream had massive chunks of plums in it and it is so creamy! The waffle cones are made fresh there and they are delicious; my boyfriend thinks they are too sweet but I disagree. I recommend this place to all of my friends that live in the Pittsburgh area. I can't wait to come back once my tummy settles from my most recent visit.

V3-FoBJ1YhUOagoL5SdkAg.text: Yea they were awesome. Different unusual flavors and nice staff and nice place. They use actual metal spoons for tasting which is very nice and matches the quality of what they make. I literally tried every flavor before purchasing and the dude was totally cool. I think my favorite was the cantaloupe and tangerine sherbet. Wow that was amazing. The ice cream I went with was almond butter it reminded me of my mothers almond butter cake. Soo good. The hazelnut I mixed with ended up being not as good as I thought in the beginning. The waffle cone was made fresh as well. I even got to taste a flavor they ran out of which was awesome. The Vietnamese coffee. Seriously through the sherbet was fantastic. Enjoy

zrGJUCjxXQ3Lj_W2yGVX9A.text: We never go to Millie's for some out of the box creative ice cream, they have the classics covered well enough. Try either their chads vanilla or their Vietnamese coffee and you'll be happy. Their waffle cones are some of the best and freshest I have had.   Very casual, in a great section of town for a nighttime stroll or chill on their picnic tables outside. Summer hot spot but great to grab in the winter with no line.

AN0Qn0Dv1JfmkWueuhds4w.text: The ice cream was good but not great. I wasn't too impressed. Also a bit overpriced and I'm coming from NY.

_FirZ74E0L1RSuWRGzAIlg.text: Ice cream is fantastic but had to leave the long line...hankering for affogato and miss the option to have :(

HcxKLrdELH7u8b7m9OXcyw.text: I agree with previous reviewers. My daughter and I were not impressed by this ice cream. It's icy like it has freezer burn. Some flavors were powerful but not in a good way. Her caramel ice cream was like a smack of caramel rather than an indulgence. We both prefer the creamy goodness of Dave & Andy's. We'd even choose Cold Stone over Millie's.  On the other hand, they did an awesome job on the remodel. The place is so much bigger now! And adorable! The decor won't be enough for a repeat visit.

iG-ceEDlhiOZFfqbAH-1rw.text: The waffle cones alone are worth a visit. Add rich, homemade ice cream scooped by a friendly member of their staff and it's a home run. Don't be put off if there's a line - it'll move fairly quickly.  Limited indoor and outdoor seating. The neighborhood is busy so I usually park on Carron or Emerson.

HmUZXs711fmPyGekjaE5Hw.text: By far the best ice cream in town. I've never had a flavor I didn't like. My fiance works next door so we visit often. Today I was in and they were busy as normal. We were visiting because they had a few new flavors. We asked to try a few before ordering our cones. Upon the request, the manager, Dana, visibly rolled her eyes at me twice.  I've met the owner before and he was beyond friendly, I can't believe this is how he wants his business represented.  Her job is to deal with customers and she failed. Upon leaving my fiance informed me that Dana always gets an attitude when you ask to sample a flavor. This is unacceptable from anyone who deals with customers but especially a manager. Again the owner is awesome and so is the ice cream

JxboWWslmUEbGuHNY7B5JQ.text: Their ice cream is the best I have tried in Pittsburgh. You can try the flavors before you make decision about what flavors you want to choose. I tried the best chocolate, Vietnamese coffee, coconut lime, super delicious! The waffle core also tastes good!

tAOgeREJnW7mvm1WJiCb5g.text: Stopped in to grab something sweet after dinner at nearby Mad Mex. They have a wide variety of flavors and plenty of seating. The chocolate ice cream was delicious, and the staff really seemed to have a good time working there. While we were eating, they (and half of the shop) burst out  into song because a Lady Gaga song came on the radio. It was a great experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. chocolate ice cream + good company :)
Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. chocolate ice cream

4LUTgjEVEXAjuzles7zPGA.text: Good tasting ice cream.  Not "the best in the world" as some of the other reviewers would have you believe but it is perfectly good tasting.  The line was a pretty long wait, and I think the main reason for this is that one of the workers seemed to be doing all the work, while the other 2 workers were just standing in the back talking to each-other the whole time I was there.  Maybe if they helped out the line would move quicker.  I had to wash my hands twice because the counter where you pay was sticky and my ice cream toppings were overflowing and unavoidably made my hands sticky.  But a problem is there is no hand dryer or paper towels to dry your hands in the bathroom.  Also pretty expensive, it was $7.49 for a Sundae $2.75 for a small bottle of water (the bottle of water was also sticky too).  I would have taken a picture of the receipt but they said they ran out of receipt paper.  They said they ran out of several of the toppings also.  It's kind of a neat quirky place tho, like the ice cream scoop door knobs, and a very simple menu with unique flavors and they say it's all home made and from local farmers and stuff.  It just didn't live up to all the hype for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

IODdZXpZgKTqxO1xEOGYvw.text: This establishment is not accessible - if you have someone with mobility issues/wheelchair - someone else has the get them ice cream and eat outside (only great during the summer). It's disappointing from such a popular place. I hope the owners are planning on making changes to become more inclusive.   I was craving a big ole scoop of vanilla. I didn't think I needed to try it before ordering. After, I regretted my decision. Who takes vanilla ice cream and decides that they need to add SALT. It wasn't terrible, but it was very unpleasant. I ended up tossing it after a few bites. Due to this experience, I will not be returning.  I would recommend trying it but don't bring your family members or friends with disabilities.

VoxIKL3Qo2Cql8R91S1X6w.text: GET. IN. MAH. BELLY. Seriously. So good.  Confession: I was one of those Pittsburghers that had not had Millie's until very recently. Shame. One of those let's-go-here-and-it-never-happened things. Until the Open Streets event in Point Breeze where I experienced the Vietnamese coffee and ohmygawd I have not gotten over it. I don't know how they make it so delicious but if you love, even LIKE, coffee, this is a must try.   I have been back a few times and had the coffee and vegan chocolate (creature of habit). I did branch out once when they had blueberry pancake and it rocked my world. What really sent me over the edge was when I bit into a chunk of ACTUAL PANCAKE AND SYRUP that apparently came directly from Square Cafe. Shut. UP. It was like a dream. Millie's has taught me to try more new things in my life.  So if you're into ice cream that gives you all the feels, go here. Don't be afraid of the line, either. IT IS WORTH IT.

5A0GWJ_mHSbW8cKQ--mRiA.text: We stopped in one evening after dinner across the street, and my wife and I decided to split a chocolate milkshake. It was dark chocolate, which is my favorite, and it tasted great! In addition, my wife mentioned that she's gluten-free, and the staff was very accommodating, going into the back to get a fresh batch of ice cream to make the shake as to prevent any cross-contamination.  Pretty great experience, and I'd come back for more next time I'm in the area!

No4pnu8UncvM_YfgUwraVA.text: First time visiting the Shadyside location! Quick service even with a line out the door and man I love this ice cream! They have great basic flavor and many other cool options. I love that they have dairy free options for vegans and those who can't eat dairy. This night I chose the dairy free chocolate and boy was It good! Tasted exactly like normal ice cream and the waffles cones are delicious!! Big fan! And the little marshmallows at the bottom to stop It from leaking is so smart! As well, you can purchase lactaid pills at this shop by the register for 50 cents! Very inclusive towards people who may have forgotten a pill! The shop itself is small but they have tables outside to sit on. When's it's busy towards the time after dinner there's not much room to sit but you can walk along the street and check out the other stores and restaurants!

W14-GgqKFAMgPIbLT8AmJQ.text: wonderful!! i love it here. parking can be rough so plan for that. they change up their flavors often so it keeps you coming back. The workers are so so sweet here and will let you taste any of the flavors which is nice. for sure come here!!

photos.caption: Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. single cone of hazelnut brownie and peanut butter ice cream

rH1-9s16ZJdE-wfl87R_vQ.text: This is probably my third time at millie's and my evaluation has been oscillating between 4 and 5 stars. However, today the ice cream was really delicious. Perhaps it was due to the unusual flavors, but I loved it and it made me eager to come back tomorrow.  Remember to enjoy the patio in the backyard! It's gonna be a great place to hang out in a month or so.

photos.caption: Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lavender and viet coffee / dairy free chocolate and vanilla

cIiuKLT9H3zvRgrn6KEGuQ.text: I got your basic single chocolate scoop in a waffle cone! The flavor was rich and creamy. The line was long but moved pretty quickly and the youngsters scooping the ice cream didn't rush you but patiently answered questions and let you have a sample or two. (Or at least they did for me!) It was nice to have a space outside to snack, but trash cans were pretty full. My treat cost just a smidge less than $6, though, which I thought was a tad high!

FQbwF2ScG2bsJQ3LnHGBDQ.text: Bougie ice cream in a bougie neighborhood.  What can I say. It's pretty darn good.  Vegan options available as well.  Small size should be enough to satisfy most, as it is pretty generous.

photos.caption: Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Njwt9zgcMUAJBiFLLlqdFw.text: Millie's...what a classic. I may or may not have strategically planned mine and my boyfriend's anniversary dinner so that we were within walking distance of Millie's...Anyway, this is a must-go for ice cream during any PGH visit. I was delighted to find out that they had olive oil in-house that day - this is my absolute favorite Millie's flavor and I only see it on the menu every once in a while! The creaminess of the oil makes for such a smooth ice cream, and the sweetness of the scoop is cut by the oil, which makes it nearly impossible to put down. I paired this with the new Scoop Shop, which is a sweet cream ice cream with peanuts, sprinkles, cherries, waffle cones, caramel, and fudge - how can you go wrong! The pairing of the not-as-sweet olive oil with the super sweet (but fantastic) scoop shop was excellent and left me wanting even more. Long story short, Millie's is awesome and every Pittsburgher and visitor needs to try the deliciousness.

photos.caption: Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Scoop of olive oil, scoop of scoop shop!

TqbFAUMfVxlURH_z_vd3pQ.text: What a cute little ice cream shop! Not sure if it's mom and pop or if it's a chain, but they have such creative flavors. It was definitely 30 degrees and snowing the day I visited, but I still ordered a small cup with lavender and vietnamese coffee flavors. I really wanted it in a waffle cone (they looked so fresh!) but I didn't want to be holding one out in the cold. My friend was craving the waffle cone so badly he actually bought it by itself without any ice cream - it was soo good! I literally could have eaten one as a cookie - so crispy.

8ZwGn-8YiEzPxEz216vu_Q.text: We had a chance to stop by during our short visit to Pittsburg.  We tried a few flavors and settled on Peanut Our Way, which was peanut flavor ice cream with crushed peanuts and little chocolate pieces.  The waffle cone tasted fresh.  But I did not expect the cinnamon flavor in the waffle cone.  I smelled cinnamon when I walked into the store, but I did not associate the smell with the waffle cone having cinnamon in it.  The combination of peanut ice cream and sweet cinnamon waffle was too much for me.  Maybe it would've been okay with another flavor of ice cream.

fxZoddLBKVpHlfRU8aW-cw.text: As soon as you walk into Millie's and smell the homemade scents wafting through the door, you'll know why this place is so sought after. With rotating flavors, Millie's has unique flavor options that you won't be able to find any where else! They even sell pints of ice cream to-go. Some of my favorites include the dulche du leche and lavender ice cream flavors. Their waffle cones are also hand prepared and rolled right in front of you!  If I'm not in the mood for a cone, I like to get a cup of ice cream with waffle crumbles sprinkled on top.

photos.caption: Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lavender ice cream

y0fSmq1BhAtC3HnPlJG8_w.text: The most logical place to go to after departing Noodlehead next door, if you have space left in your stomach of course.  The ice cream is just fantastic. We had the chocolate and the Vietnamese coffee. I personally love coffee ice cream and I love Vietnamese coffee so it's naturally what stood out for me to order.  The ice cream is super creamy and every spoonful begs for another.  If you're finishing up eating next door and want some dessert or if you're just hanging out in Shadyside wondering what you should do, stop in here and get some super delicious ice cream.

8Ite7PVafjA43whhMuKkTg.text: Expect a line, but also expect really good ice cream.   If it's there, try the plum and white chocolate. It was not a flavor I thought I would like or even wanted to try, and I ended up getting it and absolutely loving it after one of the employees convinced me to sample it.   The one issue with Millie's is that there is only a limited number of flavors and they cycle them out a lot, so if you have one you like, you may not be able to go back and get it again. Having said that, it also means lots of variety and new things to try, so you may see it as a plus.

q_K7cXM7potRFX7ftiw8ig.text: Most of Pittsburgh already knows how great this place is. If you are not one of them, fear not, I sadly only finally went recently lol  Tips: if the long line deters you just wait! It goes by fast and the moment you get a whiff of inside, you'll want to linger for as long as you can.   Also, the vegan chocolate ice cream IS AMAZING!!!! I haven't stopped thinking about it.

dcc1hEe28pOppWvOp54Z8Q.text: Not the biggest fan of their flavors. The coffee flavor is extremely strong so it's great if you love drinking coffee, but for me it was just way too bitter. The waffle cones are cooked with cinnamon, but sometimes they tend to overcook the cones so I had a burnt tasting cone last time. Overall, it's just a bit overrated in my opinion.

0F5GnMV1Ax95YInqgBMYJg.text: Sometimes there's unnecessary hype around a place. BUT THIS HYPE IS SO NECESSARY.  This is ice cream done right-- Fresh with high quality ingredients. There's always a small selection of rotating flavors, but let me tell you about a flavor that's always on the menu: Chad's Vanilla. It's seriously the best vanilla ice cream I've ever had.   You might be wondering who Chad is and what makes his vanilla so spectacular. Well, Chad is the chef/ice cream maker and you'll have to ask him what kind of magic he is using, because I have no idea. To my uncultured palate, this vanilla seems to be salted just a bit more than most vanilla ice creams.  Maybe that's what makes it so special?  I usually top the vanilla with some fancy cherries and then purchase one of the lactaid pills they keep near the counter AND MY LIFE IS COMPLETE.

4qX9rYjCsnX_gwt2iytZlQ.text: The first few times I came here I was underwhelmed. I found their ice cream had an excellent creamy texture, but I like ice cream that has a strong flavor, and their flavoring was a little too subtle. I was specifically unimpressed by the dulce de leche, which is normally one of my favorites. Nevertheless, I continued coming here, and some of their other flavors are really spot on!  The last time I came here they had a special flavor: yuzu meringue pie, which was absolutely delicious! Yuzu is an Asian citrus. I am often skeptical of citrus flavors, but this one was bright and summery while still have a smooth creamy texture. I also had the Vietnamese coffee, which I quite enjoyed (you can get multiple flavors in a scoop!). I love how the whole store smells like waffle cones, and you can watch the staff making them  This place is worth visiting, but choose your flavors wisely!

photos.caption: Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Yuzu meringue pie and Vietnamese coffee -- both were great!

2T6dNpyYPVH2pPESkBuNYw.text: Our family loves Millie's. Chad is awesome and has really come up with some great flavors that are ever changing. Millie's has everything from vanilla and chocolate to lavendar, thai tea, apricot saffron and so many more.   We really love the picnic table seating out back because it's a little more private and let's the kiddo move around freely. There is plenty of seating inside and in the front as well.  The inside of Millie's is clean and white with an awesome Pittsburgh mural on one wall. Everything is simple but cute.

photos.caption: Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Apricot saffron

vCg8k2jQLa5_jeyWTVqPag.text: Maybe it was a bad night because all of the reviews are so good except for mine. We waited in line to get half melted, odd tasting ice cream. I'm surprised they even let us pay for the bowl of milk soup. They seemed busy and stressed so I just paid and left. I don't know if I would try again since it was already an expensive mistake.  Update: the owner did reach out to me to offer me to try them again and he was upset I had a bad experience. I thought that was very nice and it shows he truly cares!

tJXIQIK6HSiK8NBQ1tL7Tw.text: Rich, flavorful ice cream served by a patient staff; they told me that there are unlimited samples! The white chocolate with toasted almonds and cherries tasted just like its description in ice cream form. And the almonds were perfectly toasted. The salted caramel was very rich and equally True to its namesake. Both delicious. I tried The coconut lime and rhubarb sorbets which were fine - I'm not a huge sorbet fan. They were True to taste but not sweet enough for me. My mom loved the coconut. But to me, it just tasted like lime-flavored coconut cream.   Overall, Millie's has richly authentic flavors which make it a unique and worthwhile treat for your tastebuds.  5/5 for ice cream 3.5/5 for sorbet

photos.caption: Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Coconut lime sorbet

JNWfDjniIjOkGha_s4E6xQ.text: I'm not much an ice cream fan but their chocolate ice cream in a waffle cone was actually quite enjoyable; their stuff tastes very fresh. The seating outside was nice and had fewer rambunctious children.

3vwmwttC_TekKVsw0VyHpg.text: Came here on a Friday night and the line was out the door! I absolutely loved my first few licks of the ice cream, but not so much for the last few licks, making this very hard for me to decide on an appropriate rating for Millie's. The ice cream flavors are so creative and they're flavors you usually don't find anywhere else. The hubby and I got Vietnamese Coffee and Thai Iced Tea flavors and they were both to die for until we got halfway into them and we were just so sick of the sugar overload. We also opted for the waffle cone ($1 extra) which added even more sweetness to our already super sweet scoops. I will say, though, the flavors we had were on point; tasted exactly like Vietnamese coffee and Thai tea! However, just a bit too rich after a while. The hubby usually cannot get enough of ice cream but he couldn't finish his cone at Millie's. Unfortunately, him and I both wasted some ice cream which was a shame because they were absolutely delicious. You probably don't hear this much, but perhaps a smaller portion would make the delicious flavors more enjoyable.   It's definitely spacious in here with both indoor and outdoor seating. The decor is bright and fresh and the workers are friendly, patient and helpful. Overall, I would come here again and again no matter how long the line was, but maybe do without the waffle cone to cut down my sugar intake ever so slightly.

photos.caption: Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Thai iced tea
Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Vietnamese coffee on waffle cone

v8k4wgX7KsflF02Iv5Ee-Q.text: Awful tasting stuff. I couldn't even finish my mango coconut.  The waffle cone was too thick and tasted like a super sugary cookie -yuck.

w-uxhDJccJ2RBgdK_dkKJw.text: This place is a chic, neat and trendy ice cream shop on the East End... Prices are cheap and the place is beautiful inside.. The staff are very friendly as well... Nice outside seating. I got the brioche which was different but was pretty good... Girl got a waffle cone that she enjoyed.. I will def go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

3kiV6mLUiQC2k8k57jCVlA.text: After two excursions to Millie's, I can safely say Millie's ice cream is good but not the best ice cream ever, as many reviews claim. That said, if reviews were based solely on smells, Millie's would win. When you walk into Millie's, the first thing you notice is the smell. It smells like cookies baking, thanks to the waffle cones they cooking behind the counter. The clean and tasteful interior will not go unnoticed as well. With pink striped walls, white subway tiles, and a compelling smell, you feel like you are in an ice cream shop! As far as ice cream goes, it is very good, especially the peanut brittle which tastes like a peanut butter cookie. I do wish they had more options for flavors, or stocked up better. My second visit I went around 7:00, only to find they were out of two flavors and almost out of one. Lack of flavors beside, the best part of Millie's was the waffle cones- you cannot go to Millie's without trying one! Their heavenly waffle cones taste like cookies, and are probably the best I have ever ate.  To make the experience even more delightful, the staff was helpful and friendly. Millie's was definitely worth a second trip, and will be worth a third.

fjkHCyRxENJjaIsc2Lcqbw.text: I've visited Millie's many times and I am never, ever disappointed. A few days ago I ordered the gingerbread ice cream in a waffle cone and it compelled me to happily hand over 5 stars.   This place is great because they let you try any and all of the flavors -- which you'll need to do because: 1) the pressure to pick "the one" (or two..?) is something you don't want to screw up and 2) the flavor combinations are sometimes bizarre until you try them and you're like omghowisthisnotalreadyaflavor.   I urge you to stand in the line no matter how long it is because it is worth it. On top of that, thanks for showing love to the lactose intolerant (you can purchase lactaid pills) and for making a self-serving water station easily accessible. The staff is always helpful and in "all hands on deck mode."  And a very cute note: I used the restroom and there is a coat hanger for adults and then one low enough for children. (Awwwww.)

gbqn39FTkHFKQKkWiQxZFA.text: Stopped and grabbed the Vietnamese coffee and mint flavors which were some the best my wife and I have had. They had a very natural homemade flavor which is hard to find nowadays, not too sweet and accurate to what they're mimicking. Our only complaint was the ice cream was almost not cold enough and started melting almost immediately even on a cold drizzly day. The texture while rich was not the creamiest nor did it had live that slightly chewy texture you find in certain ice cream parlors like Tofts or Eric's Irresistable Ice Cream in Ohio. Overall though my wife and I really like this place and plan on coming back!

YyrNQMr2ZCUaCs6I4Km7wQ.text: Millie's is BAE. That's really all there is to it. They have such a cool twist on traditional flavors, and I love the fact that they use local ingredients! They rotate their flavors often (besides flavors like vanilla, chocolate, coffee, etc) to stay on season, so you know the ingredients they're using are fresh. The lines can get long, but to me that just shows how good it is. It's truly unfortunate for my diet that their new location in Market Square is a 5 minute walk from my office.

photos.caption: Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. *seasonal flavor* blueberry lime graham with cone pieces. I could eat it everyday and not be sad about it.

Um1wzthn2DQGRQekbK7JJg.text: Came here at the recommendation of a friend. The waffle cones are a must! Yum! The store has about 9 available flavors, from standard chocolate, vanilla, coffee to some more exotic pear sherbet and ricotta cherry. You can order junior ($3) small ($4) or large ($5) and add a waffle cone for $1. I got a small which had two sizable scopes of vanilla and the BEST chocolate . The vanilla was a bit rich for me but the chocolate had a more subtle sweetness. The waffle cone was perfectly crispy and thick! I highly recommend. They also have floats and sundaes available.   Think next time I'll get a junior as I was sugar overloaded by the end. I'd also try some of their more subtle less rich flavors like the sherbet. Also would love some outdoor seating in front. Will def be back in a nice day!

photos.caption: Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Small waffle cone with vanilla and the BEST chocolate

oJqx9_Qzi7SMX8DfFZZHrw.text: There are excellent craft beer selections at some bars, but at Millie's there are excellent craft ice cream selections.   I think they take the ice cream a bit seriously, but they cater to a hip/millenium vibe so I will let it slide.  Excellent waffle cones are made fresh and really adds a nice flavor and texture.   Priced on high end but it's definitely high quality and you get what you pay for!

A-jR-Il4ROxbK1FWvKJipg.text: Great spot to come for an evening dessert or a cold treat on a hot day. Homemade ice creams with seasonal flavors that really hit home. The fresh-smelling waffle cone scent as you walk in the door paired with the friendly staff really makes you want to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Honey - Pistachio

SVZTikzrFMq-uSq_qLLMsQ.text: Went there for a date night a few months back and cannot get enough of this place ! ABSOLUTELY LOVED IT! Best place hands down in shadyside also location is perfect!

photos.caption: Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

gDbuacqneapUvAeDDk63Pg.text: This place had some of the most distinct flavours of ice creams that I've tried. It had a lavender falvoured ice cream which I found really nice with a great subtle taste coming in from the lavender. Their waffles are amazing too.. They have some flavours like salted caramel as well which again seemed new and fascinating to me ... Definitely worth trying if you're in and around the Shadysife neighbourhood..

photos.caption: Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Long queues to get in

P4jP4g_vC791cTM5Lzwzaw.text: I'm picky when someone tells me they know of a great homemade ice cream place. My friend whose a Pittsburgh native brought me here. The placed smelled of warm waffles and though I planned to get a waffle cone i was too full from my dinner so I ended up getting a chocolate milkshake. My friend got a waffle cone with lavender and coconut ice cream. That lavender was bomb! It smelled so delish and tasted absolutely milky, silky good! My milkshake was devine! The place is a absolutely must if you want some amazing ice cream! I love that they change flavors all the time also.

YY_nxlmATRZUU1Le1mPlow.text: Millie's Millie's Millie's.  What can I say about you?  You're perfect.  Let's get married.   For real though...Chad has quite the business going on here.  My husband and I used to get ice cream from him out of his mobile cart in Highland Park and so happy to see that they've opened up shop. Can't beat their waffle cones (with the surprise marshmallows in the bottom).  The East End was in need of a good ice cream (not gelato, not fro-yo) place and they filled that void.

bg1YYrwQvpef9IehG5OYRw.text: Millie's is clean, has friendly employees, and of course awesomely yummy flavors of ice cream. Can't wait for the second location to open! And don't stop selling in stores...

IRa5_GzR96ulB54m9f6C8w.text: Millie's is my favorite spot for ice cream in Pittsburgh! I love the fact that their ice cream is homemade (aka free of harsh chemical preservatives). The ice cream itself is always super fresh and delicious- this time around I tried out the cookie dough, which was AMAZING (as anticipated). I'm also obsessed with their homemade waffle cones!! They have a unique flavor due to the added cinnamon and nutmeg. To prevent melted ice cream from dripping out of the bottom of the cone they place a mini marshmallow before scooping the ice cream.  The shop itself is really nice with indoor and outdoor seating, both out front and in the back. They also have complimentary water and cups at the self service bar equipped with napkins, spoons, etc.   Now go indulge with some Millie's ice cream!!

photos.caption: Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cookie dough ice ream and waffle cone

V9-JtqGDdSC7i2tPY3tAEQ.text: I am an absolute ice cream fanatic. When I moved to Pittsburgh, I knew I would have to make it to Millie's before the summer's end. Finally, on a Saturday night, I made it happen! There was a line out the door and the outdoor seating area was crowded, which really speaks to how much people love this place.   When you walk in, the divine smell of homemade waffle cones hits you. I rarely order waffle cones, but had to try one after waiting in line and watching an employee make/roll the cones. I opted for the dairy-free mint chocolate chip ice cream and there was no disappointment to be had. I couldn't even tell that my ice cream was missing the dairy component! For those who go full dairy, the shop sells Lactaid for 50 cents, which is genius.   Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed Millie's and will be back with more friends in tow. Thanks for supplying Pittsburgh with such delicious ice cream!

J8prNP6QPdILZ2U7C_VWzQ.text: If there is only one spot you can visit in Pittsburgh, I would make it Millie's. I lived in Pittsburgh for one year and on the top of the list of places that left a good memory is this one (and Espresso A Mano). I think it's one of the best ice cream places I have been in the US. The beauty of it is you smell the freshly made waffle cones blocks away. So warm and inviting. The place is cute and clean. Seats are available inside and outside. The ladies selling the ice cream were always nice. Flavors keep changing and were always good. I like gelato more than ice cream. Since I had better gelato in my days (outside the US) I cannot give it five stars. My exotic favorites outside the US mainland are taro, toasted almonds, cactus fruit and whole milk/mastic gum pistachio gelatos. Millie's, here were some ideas for more flavors..   I still like this place a lot.

GywMJVHzKbJKtGhmJl-jfw.text: I wanted to give a 3.5/5 but ended up rounding it up. This ice cream shop is super cute, clean and very organized.  There are about a dozen flavors they have in the cases including chocolate, Vietnamese coffee, DF yuzu, etc. Most of the flavors are not local or anything super special.  The single scoop is $4.50 and you can split the scoop with two different flavors.  The waffle cone has CINNAMON and at the bottom of the cone is two small marshmellows (if you don't like cinnamon, I suggest you get it in a cup).  Overall good ice cream, but wasn't outstanding.

photos.caption: Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chocolate in waffle cone
Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chocolate in waffle cone + Vietnamese coffee in cup
Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Inside

e7aSOBFUW2IV0AFaZsQPdw.text: 2 stars because the staff were very helpful, eager and nice. But the ice cream might be a little hyped. The waffle cones are handmade and smell amazing when you walk in- for me the smell was almost a little overwhelming.   I came in with my Fiance because we had just finished eating Thai food next door and wanted something sweet. I tried the mango, couldn't even finish my spoonful. I was expecting it to be more fruity and it tasted much more creamy and the mango was an after-thought. Tried the Viet Coffee flavor and wondered where the flavor was. My Fiance really liked their peanut butter flavor so he ended up getting that but I left without getting anything. They have maybe 10-12 flavors available and none of them sounded very appetizing to me after trying the first 2.   Honestly have had better ice cream many other places. Maybe I'll have to go in when they have different flavors available.

photos.caption: Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Prices

8BSJ6aADt1p4sBkL2BTqXg.text: Millie's is my go-to ice cream spot in the Burgh!! They have such fun flavors and their waffle cones are simply delicious. Vietnamese coffee is my all time favorite flavor (sweet and minimally bitter) but the peanut butter is a close second (it has nuts and chocolate chips in it that add to the nutty flavor)!!  I also appreciate that they have gluten free cones now and some vegan options as well!!

photos.caption: Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Peanut butter in a waffle cone
Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Gluten free cake cone with vegan banana and dark chocolate

kyI8QMSsZWcQSMoQUtorBQ.text: I have to say, after all the amazing reviews, I also have to join the minority in saying that I wasn't very impressed with Millie's. There was a short line when we came on a hot summer night but it moved quickly. They list all the flavors on the board facing you as you stand in line so you have plenty of time to make a decision. They do give you samples if you ask for it! I tried the peanut butter and the mint, can't say I liked either of them. The peanut butter tasted a bit too salty and the mint was creamy, but a bit bland. I ended up ordering two small scoops of mint and coffee in a cone. Didn't want to hold up the line and try anymore. The coffee was way sweet and ended up being monotonous after the first few bites. I tried the rest of the fam's flavors and the mango gelato was pretty good. The blueberry sorbet was way tart but refreshing. The best thing about this place was the freshly made waffle cones! I liked the strong cinnamon and spices you can taste in the cone. They were crispy and on the thinner side so didn't feel like it was too much. But at $26 for 4 people, it's a bit steep for mediocre ice cream! I've had better - the flavors need to stand out and be a bit stronger! Plus for it being right next to Noodlehead though cause it makes a good dinner/dessert option!

photos.caption: Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Small Scoop of Mint and coffee on the bottom that you can&#39;t see in a waffle cone

nJVUOsnpoEdK3FDjCcCR1Q.text: "O-M-G! No wonder they have such good Yelp reviews!" exclaimed my ice cream loving 6 year old after just one bite. I was thinking similar thoughts after a bite of their salted cookie dough ice cream. I had recently had cookie dough ice cream at my favorite ice cream shop near my house, shoutout to Graeters. I have to admit that Ms. Millie could teach Mr. Graeter about how to make a good cookie dough ice cream because this one was truly 5 stars.  Our 7pm Saturday night arrival was just perfect because we walked right in. 20 minutes later we were leaving and the line was out the door, although ice cream this good may be worth waiting in line for.   It would be hard to order anything besides the salted cookie dough flavor now that I"ve tasted it, but I bet all their flavors are delicious. I'll definitely be back next time I'm in Pittsburgh and hope that Millie finds her way to Chicago one day!

_TcJReKLy02-twn8HiVMHA.text: The line is never long, the menu rotates every season, and the flavors are creative (and tasty!). What more could a girl want. Protip: get the Vietnamese coffee ice cream pint to go! Works great in a homemade affogato.

photos.caption: Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cherry pie ice cream on a sugar cone

F-Zo9YVWKGOlNc_Xk4_VMA.text: Ice cream... delicious! I had "The Best Chocolate" and thoroughly enjoyed it.  Facility: Great spot in the Shadyside area. Conveniently located next to some solid dinner locations. Outdoor and indoor seating locations.  Staff: Friendly and efficient staff!  Parking: Only negative I could possibly add is that parking in the area is a bit limited.  My wife and I have a sweet tooth so I can guarantee they'll be seeing us again .

photos.caption: Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. We can confirm... they make it right!!
Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Little bit of a line but they are well staffed and get through it quickly.
Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Iem1oCuy8fJCdtNTuRNVmw.text: This place is so dangerous because as soon as you walk in the smell gets to you. You think you'll just have something small, but then the flavors are all interesting, the samples satisfying and I end up with a homemade waffle cone and two flavors. Oh well, I can always practice self-control somewhere else.   I absolutely love the Vietnamese Coffee, but then there is always another flavor that is interesting that I add because I have yet to try it. This past weekend I wanted to try the choc chip cookie dough. It was salted and such a great balance with their vanilla ice cream.    There is also something about the music they have playing that just makes it a great time hanging out with your friends, no matter what time of year it is. Everyone leaves filling content, happy and ready to take on the world.

photos.caption: Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

CtlPSN5xPYmxZ7qY2M8BxQ.text: While the ice cream is absolutely delicious, there is no ADA entrance. There are several stairs to get in the front entrance and no alternate entrance. So, if you're a wheelchair user like me, you're out of luck unless someone can go in and get ice cream for you.

photos.caption: Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Front entrance with 6 steps and no wheelchair accessible entrance.

_ZEmkAzJbXvNQGgH9I6eOw.text: The ice cream here is great, but even greater than the ice cream is the service. My friends and I came in for a sweet treat on a Friday, but one of us had to take an important conference call. The staff was kind enough to lower the music inside so that the call could be completed without a hitch. They were so kind to us! Hooray for good ice cream and good people :)

photos.caption: Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Dulce de Leche, Vietnamese Coffee

jsVtmZ8kmS07sOsRHphh_A.text: I can never say enough good things about Millie's. Their fresh, homemade ice cream is incomparable to anything else I've had in the city. I love that their flavors change daily and they typically are always featuring seasonal options.   There's some seating inside but it gets full! Outside seating is also available. Check it out ASAP!! (It's always ice cream season, after all.)

photos.caption: Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

0KITa4toSSrdFmwKHAY12A.text: Millie's is one of the staple places in Shadyside to grab a quick bite to eat. As soon as you walk in you're immersed into the smell of fresh waffle cones. The atmosphere is bright as light reflex off the white walls which always pours me in a cheery mood.   The ice cream itself is delectable. Sweet but not overpowering with different/ new flavors all the time. My current favorite/ what's pictured below is the Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough. Millie's is pretty gracious with their cookie dough pieces. I typically get one scoop because of my semi diet up I couple eat 2 or 3 scoops in a sitting.   I would also recommend as a post dinner dessert place(especially in the summer when you can sit outside on the benches)

photos.caption: Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

oQmQ63ydO6_7lQe97kFBIw.text: Really good ice cream. I got the peanut butter one because they said it was the most popular one. My friend got vanilla and loved it. I loved mine too... but literally after two mins I DROPPED IT ALL ON THE GROUND. :(((. Anyways it was really good. RIP

photos.caption: Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Right before I dropped my whole cone on the ground. :(

KdGlS8k-mB6wJ-hOm9Yw8w.text: Okay I had to add another star because I just came in to try there coconut lime sorbet and it blew my mind. Honestly how could this be so good.  When I came in I was at an annoying person who had to try at least three flavors before I settled on one. And I was trying to set a good example for the kids that I was babysitting and only getting one scoop because it was before dinner and I really regretted my choice. That coconut lime was delicious and I wish I had three scoops.  I'm looking forward to coming back to Millie's again because I have two people visiting Pittsburgh soon and I am going to take them here just to get my fix of that coconut lime. I will dream about it until then.  And I will say a shout out to the staff who always accommodates the nut allergy for the one child that I babysit and we'll go in the back to scoop his ice cream. I really appreciate the understanding in the thoughtfulness of a company that will go out of their way and their workflow in order to help keep a child safe. Even if he continues to tell me that his reaction is not that bad I will continue to ask for his to be scooped in the back.

photos.caption: Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Coconut lime!
Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

_SRuILO-4Ylcrt8h-mCkNg.text: Dairy free mint ice cream??!! We had to go. Great waffle cones too  Duejcddihehdidbdudb duhdbdiebe dinegdiehejebe. Didhriribf djduidbehdidbeidd didbrh

Ae9fv0YxtzIT25lngAeXMA.text: I've been to Millie's several times and they never disappoint! Their waffle cones are too good for you to miss out on.   They switch some of their flavors every now and then but my favorite so far is still their Vietnamese coffee. I decided to change it up this time and get the Salted Cookie Dough flavor and it could also become on of my favorites.  They let you sample their ice cream since there's just too many that look good. I also found out today that they have backyard seating!

photos.caption: Photo of Millie's Homemade Ice Cream - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Salted cookie dough

qWhOEEqQMl3DOVNHJ_TRyA.text: Millie's can do no wrong in my eyes because their ice cream is just so dang GOOD!  They launched five new flavors last night and each one was more delicious than the next.  It's my favorite ice cream spot in the city! My favorite flavor is LAVENDER!   Bonus: all of the locations happen to be next to some of my favorite restaurants in the city (noodlehead in east liberty, las velas in market square, etc)! Perfect recipe for a solid night out for dinner and ice cream

ybJfItbdjLzFMShULQS_mQ.text: I've been getting way behind on reviews lately, but Millie's is a great place to start catching up with writing them.  I visited Millie's about a week ago with a friend.  Having heard it was the cool new ice cream shop in town, I suggested that we check it out, given that my friend and I are both diehard ice cream aficionados.  As usual, my friend was game, so we headed over to Highland Ave. to check out the goods.  After sampling some other flavors, I decided to go with scoops of the peanut butter and dark chocolate on brioche ($7), and my friend decided to get the salted caramel and "the best" dark chocolate in a bowl ($4).  The brioche was much larger than expected, and came toasted from the panini press.  Its warmth made for a nice contrast to the cold ice cream, and its lightness and sweetness complemented the ice cream nicely.  While I wouldn't get it every time I get ice cream, it was something interesting and different and made for a nice extra treat.  As for the ice cream itself, it was delectable and clearly high-quality.  Its texture was smooth and its flavors were delicious, with detectable bits of chocolate and caramel.  My only complaint is that "the best" chocolate melted rather quickly, suggesting that it wasn't frozen at a cold enough temperature.  The flavors were creative, and ranged from the classic (dark chocolate, peanut butter) to the unusual (orange poppy seed).  Needless to say, my friend and I are fans.  Although she's leaving town and won't be back until mid-July, I can say for sure that I'll be back for more as the weather warms up!
